meanings.definition: To treat or worship as a god
meanings.sent1: The ancient tribe believed in deifying the sun, offering prayers every morning.
meanings.sent2: Some people have a habit of deifying celebrities, thinking they can do no wrong.
meanings.sent3: The children had fun deifying their pet cat, pretending it had magical powers.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, he was deifying her with his unwavering admiration, making her feel special.
meanings.sent5: The artist's masterpiece had a way of deifying nature, capturing its beauty in every stroke.

meanings.definition: To exalt or glorify to an extreme degree
meanings.sent1: The teacher was deifying the student's achievements, praising them in front of the whole class.
meanings.sent2: The company's marketing campaign was deifying their product, claiming it could solve all problems.
meanings.sent3: The chef couldn't help but deify his signature dish, calling it the best in the world.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was deifying, making her see him as a flawless being.
meanings.sent5: The author's words had a way of deifying the ordinary, turning everyday moments into extraordinary tales.
